title: iPhone at 10: Apple celebrates 10th anniversary of the device that redefined the mobile phone
text:

When Steve Jobs got up on stage at Apple's Macworld event on 9 January 2007 and unveiled the first iPhone , no one could have dreamed how it would change the world. 
At the time, the closest anyone had to a modern smartphone was a BlackBerry , which offered access to emails and internet and had a physical keyboard. 
Jobs described the iPhone as a combination of three things: "A widescreen iPod with touch controls, a revolutionary mobile phone and a breakthrough internet communications device." 
Unlike the BlackBerry, it had a multi-touch screen, eliminating the need for either a physical keyboard or a stylus, which had been popular on other touchscreen and PDA devices up to this point. Steve Jobs unveiling the iPhone at the Macworld Conference in 2007 (Photo: Getty Images) 
Since then, over the last decade, Apple has sold more than a billion iPhones, and has become the most valuable company in the world. 
Such has been the success of the iPhone that, as an individual business, the revenue generated by the phone alone has exceeded that of some of its rivals, including Microsoft and Google . Read More Apple boss Tim Cook earns Â£117MILLION a year - despite firms failing to meet targets 
Analysts have referred to the device as a cultural icon and most modern smartphones have been inspired by the iPhone in some way. 
There have been 11 generations of the iPhone in total, and Apple has drastically redesigned the device on several occasions, as well as altering the screen size. Original iPhone (Photo: APPLE) 
In 2014, the company introduced a larger version of the phone with the launch of the iPhone 6 Plus - the first iPhone to feature a screen over five inches. 
The iPhone also sparked the creation of the App Store , which launched in 2008 and has since driven the success of a large number of mobile app businesses, including Angry Birds, Uber and Deliveroo. The current version of the iPhone is among the most advanced devices around - enabling users to take high quality photos, post to social media and pay for goods instantly using their fingerprint.
